text: The lesser Bromeliad tree frog, (Sarcohyla arborescandens) is a frog that lives in Mexico. Scientists have seen it between 1800 and 3100 meters above sea level. This frog lays eggs in streams, and scientists have seen it in some streams in places that people have changed, such as streams where the trees have been cut down. Scientists believe human beings in Veracruz may catch this frog to eat. ==References== Category:Frogs of North America
title: Sarcohyla arborescandens
